storyTitle: As Employee, I want to receive notifications when tasks are assigned to achieve awareness of responsibilities

testCases.title: Validate notification delivery upon task assignment
preconditions: Manager user account is active and authenticated
Employee user account is active and authenticated
Notification service is running and operational
Task database is accessible
Employee has valid email address configured in the system

steps.action: Manager logs into the system and navigates to task assignment page
steps.expectedResult: Task assignment page loads successfully with option to create new task

steps.action: Manager creates a new task with title, description, deadline, and priority, then assigns it to the employee
steps.expectedResult: Task is successfully created and assigned to the employee

steps.action: Wait and monitor notification delivery time using system timestamp
steps.expectedResult: Notification is sent to the employee within 5 seconds of task assignment

steps.action: Employee logs into the system and checks notification inbox
steps.expectedResult: Notification inbox displays the new notification with task details visible

steps.action: Employee verifies notification contains task title, description, deadline, and priority
steps.expectedResult: All task details are present and accurate in the notification

steps.action: Employee clicks on the acknowledge button for the notification
steps.expectedResult: Acknowledgment confirmation message is displayed to the employee

steps.action: Manager checks the notification acknowledgment status in the system
steps.expectedResult: Acknowledgment is recorded in the system with timestamp and employee details

postconditions: Notification is marked as delivered in the system
Notification is marked as acknowledged by the employee
Notification history is updated with delivery and acknowledgment timestamps
Task remains assigned to the employee

testCases.title: Verify notification content accuracy
preconditions: Manager user account is active and authenticated
Employee user account is active and authenticated
Notification service is running and operational
Test task data is prepared with specific title, description, deadline, and priority

steps.action: Manager creates a task with specific details: Title='Q4 Budget Review', Description='Review and approve Q4 budget allocations', Deadline='2024-12-31', Priority='High'
steps.expectedResult: Task is created successfully with all specified details

steps.action: Manager assigns the task to the employee
steps.expectedResult: Task assignment is completed and notification is triggered

steps.action: Employee receives and opens the task assignment notification
steps.expectedResult: Notification is displayed in employee's notification inbox

steps.action: Employee verifies the task title in the notification matches 'Q4 Budget Review'
steps.expectedResult: Task title is correctly displayed as 'Q4 Budget Review'

steps.action: Employee verifies the task description in the notification matches 'Review and approve Q4 budget allocations'
steps.expectedResult: Task description is correctly displayed as 'Review and approve Q4 budget allocations'

steps.action: Employee verifies the deadline in the notification matches '2024-12-31'
steps.expectedResult: Deadline is correctly displayed as '2024-12-31'

steps.action: Employee verifies the priority in the notification is marked as 'High'
steps.expectedResult: Priority is correctly displayed as 'High' with appropriate visual indicator

postconditions: Notification content accuracy is confirmed
All task details are correctly transmitted from task creation to notification display
Employee has complete information to act on the task

testCases.title: Ensure high notification delivery success rate
preconditions: Manager user account is active and authenticated
100 employee user accounts are active and authenticated
Notification service is running with sufficient capacity
Task database is accessible and has sufficient capacity
Test automation script or bulk task assignment tool is available
Monitoring tools are configured to track notification delivery

steps.action: Manager prepares 100 unique tasks with varying titles, descriptions, deadlines, and priorities
steps.expectedResult: 100 tasks are prepared and ready for assignment

steps.action: Manager assigns all 100 tasks to 100 different employees simultaneously or in rapid succession
steps.expectedResult: All 100 task assignments are submitted to the system successfully

steps.action: Monitor the notification service logs and delivery status for all 100 notifications
steps.expectedResult: Notification delivery process is initiated for all 100 tasks

steps.action: Wait for notification delivery completion and check delivery status for each notification
steps.expectedResult: Notification delivery attempts are completed for all 100 notifications

steps.action: Count the number of successfully delivered notifications from the delivery logs
steps.expectedResult: Delivery count is recorded and available for verification

steps.action: Calculate the delivery success rate: (successful deliveries / 100) * 100
steps.expectedResult: Delivery success rate is at least 99% (minimum 99 out of 100 notifications delivered successfully)

steps.action: Review any failed notifications to identify failure reasons
steps.expectedResult: Failed notifications (if any) are documented with failure reasons for analysis

postconditions: At least 99 notifications are successfully delivered
Notification delivery success rate meets or exceeds 99% threshold
All delivery attempts are logged in the system
Any failures are documented for further investigation

storyTitle: As Manager, I want to view task assignment status to achieve monitoring of delegated work

testCases.title: Validate dashboard displays assigned tasks with correct details
preconditions: Manager user account is active and authenticated
At least 5 tasks have been created and assigned by the manager
Tasks have varying statuses (e.g., Not Started, In Progress, Completed)
Tasks have different priorities (Low, Medium, High)
Tasks have different deadlines
Dashboard service is running and operational

steps.action: Manager opens the application and enters valid login credentials
steps.expectedResult: Manager is successfully authenticated and redirected to the home page

steps.action: Manager clicks on the 'Task Assignment Dashboard' menu option
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard page loads and displays the task assignment dashboard interface

steps.action: Manager verifies the dashboard displays all assigned tasks in a list or table format
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard shows all tasks assigned by the manager with columns for task name, status, deadline, and priority

steps.action: Manager verifies each task displays correct status information
steps.expectedResult: Each task shows accurate status (Not Started, In Progress, Completed, etc.)

steps.action: Manager verifies each task displays correct deadline information
steps.expectedResult: Each task shows accurate deadline date in the expected format

steps.action: Manager verifies each task displays correct priority information
steps.expectedResult: Each task shows accurate priority level (Low, Medium, High) with appropriate visual indicators

steps.action: Manager locates and clicks on the priority filter dropdown and selects 'High' priority
steps.expectedResult: Filter is applied and dashboard refreshes to show only high priority tasks

steps.action: Manager locates and clicks on the status filter dropdown and selects 'In Progress' status
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard updates to show only tasks that are both high priority and in progress status

steps.action: Manager verifies the filtered results display only tasks matching both filter criteria
steps.expectedResult: Only tasks with high priority and in progress status are displayed

steps.action: Manager clears all filters to view all tasks again
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard resets and displays all assigned tasks

steps.action: Manager clicks on a specific task from the list to view detailed information
steps.expectedResult: Task detail view opens showing comprehensive task information

steps.action: Manager verifies task details include task title, description, assigned employee, deadline, priority, and assignment history
steps.expectedResult: All task details and assignment history are displayed accurately with timestamps and employee information

postconditions: Manager remains logged into the system
Dashboard data remains accurate and unchanged
All filters can be reapplied as needed
Task detail view can be closed to return to dashboard

testCases.title: Ensure dashboard access is restricted to authorized managers
preconditions: Manager user account is active and authenticated
Non-manager user account (employee or other role) is active
Unauthenticated user session is available
Role-based access control is configured in the system
Dashboard URL is known

steps.action: Open the application without logging in and attempt to navigate directly to the dashboard URL
steps.expectedResult: System redirects to login page or displays 'Unauthorized Access' error message

steps.action: Verify that the error message clearly indicates authentication is required
steps.expectedResult: Error message states 'Please log in to access this page' or similar authentication requirement message

steps.action: Log into the system using employee credentials (non-manager role)
steps.expectedResult: Employee is successfully authenticated and redirected to employee home page

steps.action: Employee attempts to navigate to the task assignment dashboard URL directly
steps.expectedResult: Access is denied with error message 'Access Denied: Insufficient Permissions' or similar authorization error

steps.action: Verify that the dashboard menu option is not visible in the employee's navigation menu
steps.expectedResult: Task assignment dashboard option is not displayed in employee's menu

steps.action: Log out from employee account and log in using valid manager credentials
steps.expectedResult: Manager is successfully authenticated and redirected to manager home page

steps.action: Manager navigates to the task assignment dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard loads successfully and displays all assigned tasks with full functionality

steps.action: Verify manager has full access to all dashboard features including filters and task details
steps.expectedResult: All dashboard features are accessible and functional for the authorized manager

postconditions: Unauthorized users cannot access the dashboard
Access control logs record all unauthorized access attempts
Authorized manager retains full dashboard access
Security measures are confirmed to be working correctly

testCases.title: Verify dashboard load time under normal conditions
preconditions: Manager user account is active and authenticated
Typical data volume is present (50-100 tasks assigned by the manager)
System is under normal load conditions (not peak usage)
Network connection is stable with normal latency
Performance monitoring tools are available to measure load time
Browser cache is cleared to ensure accurate measurement

steps.action: Manager logs into the system with valid credentials
steps.expectedResult: Manager is successfully authenticated and home page loads

steps.action: Clear browser cache and refresh the page to ensure clean test conditions
steps.expectedResult: Browser cache is cleared and page is refreshed

steps.action: Start performance timer or open browser developer tools to monitor network activity
steps.expectedResult: Performance monitoring is active and ready to capture load time metrics

steps.action: Manager clicks on the 'Task Assignment Dashboard' menu option
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard page begins loading

steps.action: Monitor the page load process and wait for dashboard to fully render with all task data
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard completes loading with all tasks, filters, and UI elements fully rendered

steps.action: Stop the performance timer when dashboard is fully interactive and all data is displayed
steps.expectedResult: Load time is recorded from click to full page render

steps.action: Verify the recorded load time is 3 seconds or less
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard loads within 3 seconds under normal load conditions

steps.action: Repeat the test 3 more times to ensure consistent performance
steps.expectedResult: All subsequent load times are within 3 seconds, confirming consistent performance

postconditions: Dashboard load time meets performance requirement of 3 seconds or less
Performance metrics are documented for baseline comparison
Dashboard remains fully functional after load time test
Manager can proceed with normal dashboard operations

storyTitle: As Employee, I want to acknowledge task assignments to achieve confirmation of responsibility acceptance

testCases.title: Validate employee can acknowledge assigned task
preconditions: Employee is logged into the system with valid credentials
Employee has at least one task assigned that has not been acknowledged
Employee has appropriate permissions to view and acknowledge tasks
System is operational and accessible

steps.action: Employee navigates to their task list or notifications section
steps.expectedResult: Task list or notifications page is displayed showing assigned tasks

steps.action: Employee selects and opens the assigned task details
steps.expectedResult: Task details page is displayed with complete task information including title, description, deadline, priority, and an 'Acknowledge' button is visible and enabled

steps.action: Employee clicks the 'Acknowledge' button
steps.expectedResult: Acknowledgment status is updated, confirmation message is displayed (e.g., 'Task acknowledged successfully'), and the acknowledge button becomes disabled or changes to 'Acknowledged' state

steps.action: Verify acknowledgment processing time
steps.expectedResult: Acknowledgment is processed and confirmation is displayed within 2 seconds

steps.action: Manager logs into the system and navigates to task management or team dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Manager's dashboard or task management view is displayed

steps.action: Manager views the acknowledgment status for the task acknowledged by the employee
steps.expectedResult: Acknowledgment is reflected accurately showing employee name, acknowledgment timestamp, and status as 'Acknowledged' in the manager's view

postconditions: Task acknowledgment status is permanently stored in the database
Task status is updated to 'Acknowledged' in the system
Acknowledgment timestamp is recorded
Manager can view the acknowledgment in their dashboard
Employee cannot acknowledge the same task again

testCases.title: Verify system prevents multiple acknowledgments
preconditions: Employee is logged into the system with valid credentials
Employee has at least one task assigned that has not been acknowledged
System is operational and accessible
Database is configured to prevent duplicate acknowledgments

steps.action: Employee navigates to their task list and opens an assigned task
steps.expectedResult: Task details page is displayed with the 'Acknowledge' button visible and enabled

steps.action: Employee clicks the 'Acknowledge' button for the first time
steps.expectedResult: Acknowledgment is recorded successfully, confirmation message is displayed, and the acknowledge button becomes disabled or changes to 'Acknowledged' state

steps.action: Verify acknowledgment is stored in the system
steps.expectedResult: Task status shows as 'Acknowledged' with timestamp and employee information

steps.action: Employee refreshes the task details page or navigates away and returns to the same task
steps.expectedResult: Task details page is displayed showing the task is already acknowledged

steps.action: Employee attempts to acknowledge the same task again by clicking the acknowledge button or attempting any workaround
steps.expectedResult: System prevents duplicate acknowledgment and displays an appropriate message such as 'This task has already been acknowledged' or the acknowledge button remains disabled

steps.action: Verify database records for the task acknowledgment
steps.expectedResult: Only one acknowledgment record exists for the employee and task combination, confirming no duplicate entry was created

postconditions: Only one acknowledgment record exists in the database for the task
Task acknowledgment status remains unchanged from the first acknowledgment
System integrity is maintained with no duplicate records
Employee receives clear feedback about the already acknowledged status

storyTitle: As Manager, I want to generate reports on task assignments to achieve data-driven decision making

testCases.title: Validate report generation with filters
preconditions: Manager is logged into the system with valid credentials and manager role authorization
Multiple tasks exist in the system with varying dates, employees, priorities, and statuses
Manager has permissions to access the reports section
System has sufficient data for meaningful report generation
PDF and Excel export functionality is enabled

steps.action: Manager navigates to the reports section from the main menu or dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Reports page is displayed with report filter form showing available filter options (date range, employee, priority, status)

steps.action: Manager selects filter criteria: date range (e.g., last 30 days), specific employee or team, priority level (e.g., High), and status (e.g., In Progress)
steps.expectedResult: Selected filters are highlighted and applied to the filter form, all selections are visible and confirmed

steps.action: Manager clicks the 'Generate Report' button
steps.expectedResult: Report is generated accurately displaying task assignments matching the selected filters, showing columns for task name, assignee, deadline, priority, status, and other relevant fields

steps.action: Verify the accuracy of the generated report data
steps.expectedResult: All displayed data matches the applied filters, calculations and summaries are correct, and no irrelevant data is included

steps.action: Manager clicks the 'Export to PDF' button
steps.expectedResult: PDF file is downloaded successfully, file opens without errors, all report data is intact and properly formatted, headers and footers are present

steps.action: Manager returns to the report view and clicks the 'Export to Excel' button
steps.expectedResult: Excel file is downloaded successfully, file opens in spreadsheet application without errors, all data columns and rows are intact, data is editable and properly formatted

steps.action: Compare data between the on-screen report, PDF export, and Excel export
steps.expectedResult: All three formats contain identical data with no data loss, formatting is appropriate for each format type

postconditions: Report is successfully generated and displayed
PDF and Excel files are saved to the download location
No data loss occurred during export processes
Report generation activity is logged in the system
Manager can access the same report again if needed

testCases.title: Verify report scheduling functionality
preconditions: Manager is logged into the system with valid credentials and manager role authorization
Manager has permissions to schedule automated reports
System scheduling service is operational
Email or notification system is configured for report delivery
Reports section is accessible

steps.action: Manager navigates to the reports section and selects the 'Schedule Report' option
steps.expectedResult: Report scheduling interface is displayed with options for report type, filters, frequency, and delivery method

steps.action: Manager configures the scheduled report: selects report type (task assignments), applies desired filters (e.g., all employees, all priorities), sets frequency (e.g., weekly, every Monday at 9 AM), and specifies delivery method (e.g., email)
steps.expectedResult: All scheduling parameters are accepted and displayed in the configuration form

steps.action: Manager clicks 'Save Schedule' or 'Create Schedule' button
steps.expectedResult: Schedule is saved successfully, confirmation message is displayed (e.g., 'Report schedule created successfully'), and the schedule appears in the list of scheduled reports

steps.action: Verify the scheduled report details in the scheduled reports list
steps.expectedResult: Scheduled report is listed with correct parameters including report type, filters, frequency, next run date/time, and delivery method

steps.action: Wait for the scheduled time or trigger the scheduled report manually if test environment allows
steps.expectedResult: Report is generated automatically as per the schedule, report contains accurate data based on the configured filters

steps.action: Verify report delivery through the specified method (check email or notification)
steps.expectedResult: Report is delivered successfully to the manager via the specified delivery method, report file is attached or accessible, and data is complete and accurate

postconditions: Scheduled report configuration is saved in the database
Scheduled report appears in the manager's list of scheduled reports
System will continue to generate reports according to the schedule
Report generation and delivery logs are created
Manager can edit or delete the schedule if needed

testCases.title: Ensure report generation performance
preconditions: Manager is logged into the system with valid credentials
System contains typical data volume representing normal operational load
Database is populated with representative task data (minimum 100-500 tasks)
System performance monitoring tools are available or timer is ready
No other heavy processes are running that could affect performance

steps.action: Manager navigates to the reports section
steps.expectedResult: Reports page loads successfully and filter form is displayed

steps.action: Manager selects filters representing typical report criteria (e.g., last 30 days, all employees, all priorities and statuses)
steps.expectedResult: Filters are applied and ready for report generation

steps.action: Start timer and click 'Generate Report' button
steps.expectedResult: Report generation process begins immediately with loading indicator displayed

steps.action: Monitor the report generation process and stop timer when report is fully displayed
steps.expectedResult: Report is generated and displayed completely within 5 seconds, all data is loaded and visible, no timeout errors occur

steps.action: Verify the completeness and accuracy of the generated report
steps.expectedResult: Report contains all expected data matching the filter criteria, no data is missing or truncated due to performance optimization

steps.action: Repeat the report generation process 2-3 times with similar data volumes
steps.expectedResult: Each report generation completes within 5 seconds consistently, demonstrating reliable performance

postconditions: Report generation performance meets the 5-second requirement
System remains responsive after report generation
No performance degradation is observed
Report data is complete and accurate despite performance constraints
Performance metrics are logged for monitoring
